Reason: The 'key_cache_save_period' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the duration set in this configuration directly impacts the frequency at which the key cache is saved to disk. Saving the key cache involves I/O operations and resource usage, and changing the save period can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the code snippet provided shows that the configuration is directly used to schedule the saving of the key cache at regular intervals, indicating its importance in system performance.
